file_content.text: Well, this has been an interesting diversion, but I think it's time to wrap things up. I call.
Come on, Lana, now...? I fold.
I know a Sith that's pleased with herself when I see one. I fold.
So soon? Must be quite a hand. Let's see it.
I know that voice.
But-- How? You discarded every chance you got and never locked a card the whole round. The odds are astronomical-- you cheated!
Even if I did, you sure the old boss of Sith Intelligence wants to admit some shifty alien got the better of her?
Gault.
Still a font of outpouring emotion, as always. You should really try your hand at cards.
I see you've met my shooting star.
They haven't seen me shooting anything. Yet.
Hylo tells me you're here on business. What are you scheming now?
I can guess why you're here.
I see this is a real love hate relationship. She's the hate, right?
Still in the doghouse, Gault?
Forgiveness is a long, hard road. With lots of toll gates.
You could start with his mouth.
Please, shoot away.
She's done enough extra chiseling on my jawline, thank you.
Much as I'd love to while away the hours with my two favorite ladies in the galaxy, my proposition's a bit time sensitive.
Much as I enjoy catching up with friends and loved ones, the window of opportunity for my little offer is steadily closing.
Wasted no time turning the card table into a graveyard.
It's my preferred method of execution.
Commander, the most untrustworthy scoundrel I know. Untrustworthy scoundrel, the commander.
She never was big on formalities. Gault Rennow, at your service.
Hello, Gault. I hear you have an offer for me.
Welcome.
How is it you two know each other, exactly?
She doesn't seem to like you.
Oh, we go way back.
I don't know, it seems like only yesterday that we first met.
Aaanyway... we really should get on to business.
I haven't got a lot of time or patience. Why are you here?
Skip the pleasantries.
Oh, I think you'll make a little of both for this.
The Eternal Empire's spent the last five years pillaging every world in the known galaxy. How'd you like to turn all that plundering into a profit for you and yours?
I'm listening.
I happen to know where they're keeping all that ill-gotten gain. Better yet, I've got a surefire plan to steal it right out from under their noses.
I just the need the help of a few talented, tough customers to see it through.
And my Alliance is the perfect place for recruitment.
People like us.
I've already picked out the ones we'll need.
And your old partner sprung to mind.
So you came to me first.
Obviously.
That's quite a score you're promising. I'm not sure I buy that you've got a line on something that big.
Sound too good to be true.
Smart.
Ahem. Trust me, friend, when it comes to fortune-finding I'm practically a Jedi.
I'd rather break Arcann's nose than steal from under it, but the consolation prize sounds nice.
I prefer payback.
Consider it a warmup for the main event.
I've been known to misappropriate funds when the need arises.
Fits my profile.
There's nothing to miss about this appropriation, that I promise.
Stealing for financial gain doesn't generally sit right with me.
I'm not a thief.
Think of it as the rightful reclamation of wealth stolen by Arcann in the first place. You'd be striking a real blow to his war effort.
What's this generous offer going to cost me?
And your angle?
Only your word, for now, and an even split after the fact. Fifty-fifty. Couldn't be more fair.
Ever heard of the Gilded Star? I'll stop you there, you haven't. It's one of the Eternal Empire's most tightly-guarded secrets.
A floating treasury circling the depths of a massive gas giant. The ship and the buried treasure all wrapped up into one neat little package.
Well, maybe not little. By my estimation, it's the greatest sum of wealth gathered in one place since the Hutt Empire was a thing. So, you in?
I'm in.
Yeah.
I don't think I need any more reasons to say yes.
That's a persuasive argument.
I hoped you'd feel that way.
You cross me on this. I bury you.
It better go like you say.
So, the standard arrangement.
When you're ready to get this show on the road, we'll be heading to Vandin to lay some groundwork.
Hope you haven't lost your edge, killer.
Looking forward to this, partner.
Hey, Commander. Got a sec?
What's on your mind?
I do.
We're doing our best to keep the supply lines running, but most of the people I deal with aren't exactly philanthropists.
We can't keep running this thing on goodwill and borrowed credits.
You're saying we need a steady income.
I take your meaning.
Or a really big slush fund.
Who are we accepting money from?
Borrowed credits?
Better if you don't know, but I'd really prefer not to be living off their kind of debt.
Aren't you supposed to be handling that?
So deal with it.
What do you think I'm doing now?
But look, I didn't just come here with complaints. I know a guy with a habit of showing up when someone's in need.
He's reached out with an offer we can't really refuse, much as I might want to. You should meet him.
Make the arrangements. I'll at least hear what he's offering.
Okay.
Well, he's already here and it's probably best not to leave him to his own devices.
So, he's what, a loan shark?
Who are we dealing with?
No, just a liar, and a cheat, and a thief.
With that kind of recommendation, how can I say no?
Seriously?
I know, I know. We've got history.
The only thing to trust about him is that he can do what he promises. Hear him out.
Come on.
We need to talk, but not now. Gimme a minute.
Attempt to cheat me and you will regret it. Briefly.
It better go like you say.
